document.title: Applying “Men and Women for Others” to Writing about Archeology
document.abstract: This essay explores one archeology professor's pedagogy of caring during a summer field study of a former state school and orphanage.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Karen Surman Paley is an assistant professor of English in composition and rhetoric at Rhode Island College. She formerly taught at two Jesuit colleges where she learned of cura personalis. Southern Illinois UP published her I-Writing: The Politics and Practice of First-Person Writing in 2001. Her work has also appeared in JAC and Reader. This essay is part of a longer study and book project of sites on writing assignments in the content areas and pedagogy of care.
